instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPRTC_G3H: What is PPRTC_G3H? This is a typo of PPVRTC_G3H When you see PPRTC_G3H, assume they meant to type PPVRTC_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with liquid damage that will not start up. Corrosion was found at <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and cleaned. Voltage at Y2705 is 1.14v when power cycles up.
Green light on charger, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6v

When power is plugged in the fan spins for 1 second then stops then starts again 5 seconds later.  

Diode mode to <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> shows short.  Any hope with this or should I not bother?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: What is your resistance to ground on CPU VCore? Doubt it’s shorted it’s a low voltage rail. Anything and everything can cause this first spot to check would be if JTAG is corroded and what you get on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message:
Diode mode measurement <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=.46 ohms
<SIGNAL>PPVRTV_G3H</SIGNAL>=3.3V

Nothing that I can see on JTAG. I put it in the ultrasonic tank and cleaned it thoroughly with alcohol and a toothbrush as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: On <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> I get a steady 6.81v on pin 1. On pin 2 I get 0v. Resistor checks out as 330k with meter. Not sure what I should be getting at pin 2 for voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: I've also checked out <RESISTOR>R5110</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5111</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5112</RESISTOR>, etc. <RESISTOR>R5121</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R5128</RESISTOR> and they all check out with correct readings.  Steady 3.3v at <RESISTOR>R6101</RESISTOR> even during power cycling.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: 8.4 volts on PPBUS would indicate some kind of issue around the SMC. Check that again if you can may be crap under the SMC if it’s 8.4. If <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is pulsing then it’s trying to turn on but can’t. Is CPU VCore pulsing as well?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: Thanks. I'll check PPVCORE again to verify. I believe that it was steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: Need resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>, not diode mode. <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> may have gotten corrupted, try another BIOS for testing but make sure to keep the old one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 1 second then pauses for 5 seconds
threads.message: Resistance to GND for PPVCORE measured at <CAPACITOR>C1681</CAPACITOR> is 26.6 Ohms. Will check out <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> closer
